section.name: Using Hippo ECM
section.p: Hippo ECM consists of a number of components that provide "out of the box" functionality. This section describes how to make use of those functionalities.

subsection.name: Hippo Repository
subsection.p: Hippo Repository is built on top of Apache Jackrabbit. Hippo Repository adds extra functionality to the default Jackrabbit distribution while keeping full compliance with JCR 1.0 JSR 170. The main added features are virtual nodes based on facets (metadata), access management, authorization and workflow.

Combining facet selects and facet searches gives you an enormeous flexibility in exposing your data in endless possible ways. Every user could have her own desirable view of the data, obviously automatically combined with their access rules!

subsection.name: Hippo CMS7
subsection.p: Hippo CMS7 is the frontend application. It is implemented with Apache Wicket using a custom plugin framework which is configured in Hippo Repository. We have created a tour to show you the key concepts you need to know to start using the CMS.
